Pre-Game Insights: Spain have won all four of their matches in the tournament, scoring nine goals and giving up one.
Germany have won three of four -- drawing the other -- and have totaled 10 goals while conceding only twice (one of which was an own goal).
While Spain's defense has conceded just once, they have likely benefitted from facing meh attacks.
Germany's defense has kept two clean sheets -- versus Hungary in group play and against Denmark in the Round of 16 -- but they were lucky do to so each time, allowing exactly 1.2 xG in both games.
Spain's attack should create chances regardless of who they're facing.
Germany's attack has mustered at least 1.4 xG in each match, including 2.6 last time out against a solid Denmark team.
